column1: 8 pts - You have identified the production function as a potential candidate for scrum/sprint methodologies, but the explanation could be more specific on how it would operate within that function.

Rating: 8 pts

Comment: Good attempt at explaining scrum/sprint for production, but could be more specific in its application to Mighty Jaxx's business function. Keep up the good work!

7 pts - Some vagueness or incompleteness in discussion of fit.

Comment: Good attempt at explaining why Kanban is not the best fit for the production process, but could use more specific examples and clarity. Keep up the good work!

8 pts - Identified business function is somewhat unlikely to benefit from kanban.

Comment: Good effort in identifying the distribution process as a potential area for implementing kanban, but more explanation on how it could benefit from kanban would have been helpful. Keep up the good work!

Rating: 10 pts

Comment: Good job on explaining how kanban could operate for the distribution function. Just a bit more clarity on the possible columns in the kanban board would make it perfect. Keep up the good work!

7 pts - Some vagueness or incompleteness in discussion of fit

Good effort in discussing the implementation of scrum/sprint and kanban methodologies in different business functions. However, the explanation of why scrum/sprint is a poor fit for the distribution process could be more specific and clear. Keep up the good work!

5 pts - Selected bias is clearly relevant to this situation.

Great job identifying anchoring bias and explaining its potential impact on Jackson's decision-making process. Keep up the good work!

8 pts - Right idea for definition, but some vagueness or illogic

Comment: Good attempt at defining anchoring bias, but it could be clearer and more concise. Keep up the good work!

Rating: 10/10

Comment: Good job on describing the anchoring bias and its impact on the business model. Just add a bit more detail on the possible problem and solution. Keep up the good work!

8 pts - Reasonable description, but missing some detail. Good effort in explaining the cognitive bias and project management methods, but could use more clarity and detail in the steps or actions. Keep up the good work!
